title: Week 5 Review & Giving/Receiving
description: Review social phrases and learn to talk about giving and receiving

vocabulary.exampleSentence: ともだちにプレゼントをあげます。
vocabulary.exampleMeaning: I give a present to my friend.

vocabulary.exampleSentence: はははかれしにプレゼントをもらいました。
vocabulary.exampleReading: Haha wa kareshi ni purezento wo moraimashita.
vocabulary.exampleMeaning: My mother received a present from her boyfriend.

grammar.formation: [Recipient] に [Object] を あげます

examples.japanese: かのじょにはなをあげました。
examples.meaning: I gave flowers to my girlfriend.

examples.japanese: せんせいにおみやげをあげます。
examples.meaning: I'll give a souvenir to the teacher.

grammar.notes: あげます = you give away from yourself. Use に for the recipient.

grammar.formation: [Giver] に/から [Object] を もらいます

examples.japanese: ちちにとけいをもらいました。
examples.meaning: I received a watch from my father.

examples.japanese: ともだちからてがみをもらいました。
examples.meaning: I received a letter from my friend.

grammar.notes: もらいます = you receive. Use に or から for the giver.

grammar.formation: [Giver] が [Object] を くれます

examples.japanese: ともだちがほんをくれました。
examples.meaning: My friend gave me a book.

examples.japanese: だれがこれをくれましたか。
examples.reading: Dare ga kore wo kuremashita ka.

grammar.notes: くれます = someone gives TO you. Shows the giver's kindness toward you.

kanji.mnemonics: A net (罒) over a shell/money (貝) - catching money to buy things.
A scholar (士) offering something to sell.

culturalNote: Gift-giving is very important in Japanese culture! When giving, say つまらないものですが... (it's nothing special, but...) even for nice gifts. When receiving, say thank you and don't open it immediately in front of the giver (unless they insist).
practiceGoals: Use あげます, もらいます, くれます correctly
Understand the direction of giving verbs
